title: Is reality an illusion? If so, how can we escape from this illusion? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Reality” is the “potential heaven”. So, you needn’t think of escaping from it. It is your destination where you may, with your “ingenious thinking”, avail the “utilities” in order to progressively turn your potential heaven into an “actual heaven”. The “objectives” you foresee are the waypoints upon this forwardly path called “life”. Veracity of the objective is felt “subjectively” as “potential happiness” which is consummated proportionately with every step forward. The objective’s veracity is proven and portrayed “physically” as “evolution” in every length of approach towards it. Thus, “happiness” and “evolution” serve as two lifeboats upon the ocean of “reality” where the “heaven” occurs as a distant island. There is no “actual illusion” in this creation. What appears as illusion is only the interspace between two pieces of information awaiting to be correlated through your intellect. The intellectually-and-emotionally lazy ones who are reluctant to exercise their wit tend become an escapist terming this “informational interspace” as “inescapable illusion”.

Even if you change your opinion about reality being an illusion, what difference with that make? It's here that's for sure, your understanding in one way or the other makes no difference. Our brain recieves signals in form of ether (electricity) and it's interpretation is reality. But our sense organs can only interpret material dimension of this reality. Mind on the contrary is free, it is not bound to this material reality. In the understanding of mind comes the answer to your question.
